SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.vector

Class Vector4

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector4
All Implemented Interfaces:
Vector, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Quaternion
public class Vector4 extends Object implements Vector
A four-dimensional vector. While usage of a Vector4 independently is scarce, it is often used as a base class for objects with four component doubles.
See Also:

      public Vector4(double w, double x, double y, double z)
      Creates a new vector from four component scalars.
      Parameters:
      w - The W component of this vector
      x - The X component of this vector
      y - The Y component of this vector
      z - The Z component of this vector

    • Vector4

      public Vector4(@Nonnull double[] values)
      Creates a new vector from an array of component scalars. The length of the array must be equal to 4.
      Parameters:
      values - Array of values to use to construct this vector

    • length

      public int length()
      Gets the length of this vector. Since a four-dimensional vector always has four components, this always returns 4.
      Specified by:
      length in interface Vector
      Returns:
      4

    • magnitude

      public double magnitude()
      Gets the magnitude of this vector.
      Specified by:
      magnitude in interface Vector
      Returns:
      The square root of w * w + x * x + y * y + z * z

    • magnitude2

      public double magnitude2()
      Gets the squared magnitude of this vector.
      Specified by:
      magnitude2 in interface Vector
      Returns:
      w * w + x * x + y * y + z * z

      public double dot(@Nonnull Vector4 v)

    • sum

      @Nonnull public static Vector4 sum(@Nonnull Vector4... vectors)
      Given an array of vectors, this returns the sum of the vectors. This is faster than chaining add(Vector4) as it does not create a new instance every iteration.
      Parameters:
      vectors - Vectors to sum
      Returns:
      The sum of the given vectors

    • avg

      @Nonnull public static Vector4 avg(@Nonnull Vector4... vectors)
      Given an array of vectors, this returns the average of the vectors. This is faster than chaining add(Vector4) then dividing it by the total vector count as it does not create a new instance every iteration.
      Parameters:
      vectors - Vectors to average
      Returns:
      The average of the given vectors

    • apply

      @Nonnull public Vector4 apply(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Double> operator)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • max

      @Nonnull public Vector4 max(@Nonnull Vector4 v)
      Returns the maximum vector between this vector and the provided vector v. This is calculated by applying Math.max(double, double) to all components.
      Parameters:
      v - Vector to get the maximum between
      Returns:
      Maximum vector of the two vectors

    • min

      @Nonnull public Vector4 min(@Nonnull Vector4 v)
      Returns the minimum vector between this vector and the provided vector v. This is calculated by applying Math.min(double, double) to all components.
      Parameters:
      v - Vector to get the minimum between
      Returns:
      Minimum vector of the two vectors

    • clamp

      @Nonnull public Vector4 clamp(@Nonnull Vector4 min, @Nonnull Vector4 max)
      Given a minimum and maximum allowed range, this returns a vector which respects the given bounds.
      Parameters:
      min - Minimum allowed boundaries
      max - Maximum allowed boundaries
      Returns:
      The clamped vector

      Parses a string into a Vector4.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The parsed string
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - When the format is invalid
      IllegalArgumentException - When at least one of the components is non-finite
